03_central_limit_theorem/04_exam3/08_DMLT_prop_binom_v2

In some game, each trial has chance \(p=0.37\) of success. In other words, \(X\) is a random Bernoulli variable with parameter \(p=0.37\). To determine the following probabilities, use the de Moivreâ€“Laplace theorem (normal approximation). I have already done the continuity correction by setting the boundaries.


  1. If \(n=36\), what is the probability that the sample proportion (\(\hat{p}\)) is less than 0.4028? In other words, if \(n=36\), determine \(P\left(\overline{X}<0.4028\right)\).In other words, if \(n=36\), determine \(P\left(\hat{p}<0.4028\right)\).
  2. If \(n=81\), what is the chance the number of successes is less than 33.5? In other words, if \(n=81\), determine \(P\left(\sum X <33.5\right)\)
  3. If \(n=100\), what is the probability that the sample proportion (\(\hat{p}\)) is more than 0.345? In other words, if \(n=100\), determine \(P\left(\overline{X}>0.345\right)\).In other words, if \(n=100\), determine \(P\left(\hat{p}>0.345\right)\).
  4. If \(n=49\), what is the chance the number of successes is more than 14.5? In other words, if \(n=49\), determine \(P\left(\sum X >14.5\right)\)
